citeinfo.origin: GIS Program, Massachusetts Department of Conservation and Recreation
citeinfo.title: DCR Pools

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

descript.abstract: This point datalayer contains the location of 46 pools in Massachusetts that are owned and/or operated by the Massachusetts Department of Conservation and Recreation (DCR). Pool types include swimming, wading, diving and spray deck. The layer was developed by the DCR GIS Program and is based on DCR pool listings as of May 19, 2015.

cntperp.cntorg: Massachusetts Department of Conservation and Recreation
Massachusetts Department of Conservation and Recreation

procstep.procdesc: A list of pools was obtained from the Division of State Parks and Recreation and the Division of Urban Parks and Recreation. Each pool was on-screen digitized using a variety of sources (address information provided on http://www.mass.gov/dcr/recreate/pools.htm, ortho imagery, pictometry, etc.). Each pool type and status was verified with ortho imagery and pictometry and, if necessary, by DCR District Managers. Lifeguard status was verified via the DCR Waterfront Services Schedule (http://www.mass.gov/dcr/recreate/waterfront.htm). Universal accessibility was verified by the DCR Universal Access Program and DCR District Managers. Physical addresses and phone numbers were imported from the DCR Pools website (above) and verified or refined to the greatest extent possible. Each pool name was researched in the Massachusetts Acts and Resolves Session Laws from 1692 to 2008 (available via the Massachusetts Executive Office for Administration and Finance website). The applicable legislation was recorded in the LEGISLATION field. Finally, the REGION and DISTRICT fields were populated via a spatial join between this datalayer and an in-house DCR regions and districts datalayer.

Pool type and accessibility attributes were updated to reflect on-the-ground changes as a result of the DCR's pool modernization project. Pool address and phone attributes were also updated with more accurate information, where available.

cntperp.cntorg: Massachusetts Department of Conservation and Recreation

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

edom.edomvd: Water depth of at least two feet.
Water depth between one inch and two feet.
Water depth of at least ten feet.
Zero water depth; may spray continuously or on demand.

attr.attrdef: Phone number of pool or facility where pool is located.
DCR region where pool is located.
DCR district where pool is located.
DCR FOT (Field Operation Team) responsible for pool.
Abbreviated pool name, appropriate for map labels.

edom.edomvd: Pool is not staffed with lifeguard(s).

attr.attrdef: Unique, static ID for each pool for querying purposes.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This point datalayer contains the location of 46 pools in Massachusetts that are owned by the Massachusetts Department of Conservation and Recreation (DCR). Pool types include swimming, wading, diving and spray deck. The layer was developed by the DCR GIS Program and is based on DCR pool listings as of May 19, 2015.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Massachusetts Department of Conservation and Recreation (DCR)

prcStep.stepDesc: A list of pools was obtained from the Division of State Parks and Recreation. Each pool was on-screen digitized using a variety of sources (address information provided on http://www.mass.gov/dcr/recreate/pools.htm, ortho imagery, pictometry, etc.). Each pool type and status was verified with ortho imagery and pictometry and, if necessary, by DCR field staff. Lifeguard status was verified via the Division of State Parks and Recreation. Universal accessibility was verified by the DCR Universal Access Program and DCR field staff. Physical addresses and phone numbers were imported from the DCR Pools website (above) and verified or refined to the greatest extent possible. Each pool name was researched in the Massachusetts Acts and Resolves Session Laws from 1692 to 2010 (available via the Massachusetts Executive Office for Administration and Finance website). The applicable legislation was recorded in the LEGISLATION field. Finally, the REGION and DISTRICT and FOT (Field Operation Team) fields were populated via a spatial join between this datalayer and an in-house DCR regions and districts datalayer.
